definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
puffed/swollen/spongy/small lake (esp. in place names)/classifier for urine or feces

bubble/foam/blister (i.e. skin bubble)/to soak/to steep/to infuse/to dawdle/to shilly-shally/to hang about/to pick up (a girl)/to get off with (a sexual partner)/classifier for occurrences of an action/classifier for number of infusions

sentences.english: The plans for the town's new shopping centre were given the kiss of death by reductions in government spending.
sentences.chinese: 该镇建新的购物中心的计划因政府削减而终成泡影。

sentences.english: A plot to overthrow the government.
sentences.chinese: 他们推翻政府的企图终成泡影。

sentences.english: Owing to lack of support the scheme fizzled out.
sentences.chinese: 由于没人支持，这一计划终成泡影。

sentences.english: His dream of becoming a superstar ended in bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 他想成为超级明星的梦想终成泡影。

sentences.english: Their attempt to overthrow the government ended in nothing.
sentences.chinese: 他们推翻政府的企图终成泡影。

definition: to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
sunset, the end of the road (idiom); in terminal decline/at a dead end
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
to be shattered/to be annihilated (of hope, illusions etc)
change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/to dance to a different tune
